document_data.name: Mouli al-Ajami
document_data.mainbody: Sheikh '''Mouli al-Ajami''' was the leader of the [[House of Tayif]] tribe in the [[High Desert]] of [[west Zakhara]] around [[1367 DR]].{{AQ-time}}<ref name=LoF:AGtZ-p40">
document_data.Personality: Charismatic and intelligent, Mouli was a natural leader. All of his followers were fanatics.<ref name=LoF:AGtZ-p40"/>
document_data.Description: Mouli had striking blonde hair and blue eyes.<ref name=LoF:AGtZ-p40"/>
document_data.Activities: Mouli was a foreigner to the sands of Zakhara, hence his surname of "al-Ajami." Over time he convinced a large number of smaller tribes and clans to rebel against the [[Khalil al-Assad al-Zahir|Grand Caliph]]. He led many raids against caravans, outposts, and civilized lands.<ref name=LoF:AGtZ-p40"/>
document_data.History: Captured and tortured by [[mamluk]] slavers in [[Qudra]], Mouli quickly learned to hate civilized culture. He escaped into the desert where he began to build an army of raiders.<ref name=LoF:AGtZ-p40"/>
